messages.messageBody:
Jennifer Government, by Max Barry.

He made an online game to promote the book that's kinda fun to look at,
as well:

http://www.nationstates.net/cgi-bin/index.cgi

lisa near Chicago, generally lurking

messages.msgSnippet: ** I m trying to recall the title of a book I read...mmm..about six months ago. The premise was a point in the future in which people were so dependent on
messages.messageBody:
** I'm trying to recall the title of a book I
read...mmm..about six months ago. The premise was a
point in the future in which people were so dependent
on corporations that employees took on the last name
of the company they worked for (ie: Sheila McDonald's
or Timothy Nike).**

I believe the title is _Jennifer Government_. But I don't remember the
author.

Betsy

messages.subject: anyone know this book?
messages.msgSnippet: I m trying to recall the title of a book I read...mmm..about six months ago. The premise was a point in the future in which people were so dependent on
messages.messageBody:
I'm trying to recall the title of a book I
read...mmm..about six months ago. The premise was a
point in the future in which people were so dependent
on corporations that employees took on the last name
of the company they worked for (ie: Sheila McDonald's
or Timothy Nike). One of the early scenes involves a
kid getting killed at the mall over some fancy
sneakers or something. I don't recall it in much
detail at the minute, but it had an interesting
premise that is related to a point I'm trying to make
in one of my classes, and someone is wanting to read
it if I can recall the name of it. I'm browsing Amazon
right now, but hoping someone else can think of it
before I find it. I think there was also something in
there about computers.

TIA!
Elizabeth

=====
Elizabeth
Http://rainbowacademy.blogspot.com
